Yeah, I'm just wondering if you somehow overwrote KDE binaries with GNOM ones.....
That should be run when you choose KDE in the session thingie. I wonder why it didn't work automatically?
Try getting rid of GNOME, or at least GDM
To turn it off you can run "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop"
Did you unmount the drive properly?
I just copy and unplug it
You need to unmount, or some filesystem changes won't get written (writing EVERYTHING to disk will reduce the lifetime of a flash drive)
